thread.title: Dwight Lodeweges quits as coach of Dutch club Heerenveen
thread.title_full: Dwight Lodeweges quits as coach of Dutch club Heerenveen

title: Dwight Lodeweges quits as coach of Dutch club Heerenveen
text:
Dwight Lodeweges quits as coach of struggling Dutch top flight club Heerenveen THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   5:31   5:31   
Subjects: 
Netherlands (37) 

HEERENVEEN, Netherlands — Dwight Lodeweges has quit as coach of struggling Dutch club SC Heerenveen, leaving with the team 15th in the 18-team top flight. 
In a video message posted on Heerenveen's website Wednesday, Lodeweges said he quit "in the interests of the club" so that a new leader can get the team back on track. 
The team from the northern Netherlands narrowly missed out on a place in the Europa League last season but has struggled this term, winning only one of its nine league matches. The only team it has beaten is last-placed De Graafschap Doetinchem in the first match of the season. 
Heerenveen appointed Foppe de Haan as interim coach. De Haan worked at Heerenveen from 1985-2004, including two long stints as coach.
